net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.rtsp

Class RtspClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.rtsp.RtspClient

  • public class RtspClient
extends java.lang.Object
    RFC 2326. A basic and asynchronous RTSP client. The original purpose of this class was to implement a small RTSP client compatible with Wowza. It implements Digest Access Authentication according to RFC 2069.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RtspClient.Callback
      The callback interface you need to implement to know what's going on with the RTSP server (for example your Wowza Media Server).
      private class  RtspClient.Parameters 
      static class  RtspClient.Response

        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_CONNECTION_LOST

        public static final int ERROR_CONNECTION_LOST
        Message sent when the connection with the RTSP server has been lost for some reason (for example, the user is going under a bridge). When the connection with the server is lost, the client will automatically try to reconnect as long as stopStream() is not called.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MESSAGE_CONNECTION_RECOVERED

        public static final int MESSAGE_CONNECTION_RECOVERED
        Message sent when the connection with the RTSP server has been reestablished. When the connection with the server is lost, the client will automatically try to reconnect as long as stopStream() is not called.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(RtspClient.Callback cb)
        Sets the callback interface that will be called on status updates of the connection with the RTSP server.
        Parameters:
        cb - The implementation of the RtspClient.Callback interface

      • setSession

        public void setSession(Session session)
        The Session that will be used to stream to the server. If not called before startStream(), a it will be created.

      • getSession

        public Session getSession()

      • setServerAddress

        public void setServerAddress(java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
        Sets the destination address of the RTSP server.
        Parameters:
        host - The destination address
        port - The destination port

      • setCredentials

        public void setCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        If authentication is enabled on the server, you need to call this with a valid username/password pair. Only implements Digest Access Authentication according to RFC 2069.
        Parameters:
        username - The username
        password - The password

      • setStreamPath

        public void setStreamPath(java.lang.String path)
        The path to which the stream will be sent to.
        Parameters:
        path - The path

      • setTransportMode

        public void setTransportMode(int mode)
        Call this with TRANSPORT_TCP or 0 to choose the transport protocol that will be used to send RTP/RTCP packets. Not ready yet !

      • isStreaming

        public boolean isStreaming()

      • startStream

        public void startStream()
        Connects to the RTSP server to publish the stream, and the effectively starts streaming. You need to call setServerAddress(String, int) and optionnally setSession(Session) and setCredentials(String, String) before calling this. Should be called of the main thread !

      • stopStream

        public void stopStream()
        Stops the stream, and informs the RTSP server.
